title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1272.6 - Permission required for storage, handling or loading explosives or other dangerous articles barred by Federal regulations
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1272.6 - Permission required for storage, handling or loading explosives or other dangerous articles barred by Federal regulations

State Regulations
(a) No person shall without prior permission
of the manager keep, transport, handle or store at, in or upon the air terminal
any cargo of explosives or other dangerous articles which is barred from
loading in or transportation by civil aircraft in the United States under the
current provisions of part 103 of the Federal aviation regulations promulgated
by the Federal Aviation Administration. (b) Any waiver of such regulations or of any
part thereof by the Federal Aviation Administration or by any other competent
authority shall not constitute or be construed to constitute a waiver of this
rule or an implied permission to keep, transport, handle or store such
explosives or other dangerous articles, at, in or upon the air terminal. Advance notice of at least 24 hours shall be given the manager to permit full
investigation and clearance for any operation requiring a waiver of this
rule. Notes

1272.6
